constitutionalAuthorityStatementText:
[Congressional Record Volume 167, Number 2 (Monday, January 4, 2021)]
[House]
From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]
By Mr. DUNCAN:
H.R. 94.
Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuant
to the following:
Article I, Section 8, Clause 4 grants Congress the right to
set forth rules for Naturalization; Article I, Section 8,
Clause 18 grants Congress the duty to make Laws that are
necessary and proper for Executing it's powers. Since
jurisdictions declaring themselves to be sanctuary are
operating in a lawless manner, it is necessary and proper to
bring them back into line.
[Page H53]

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Immigration and Citizenship.

title: Mobilizing Against Sanctuary Cities Act
